Navigation
Name Rascal/Expressions/Values/Set/Product

Synopsis The product of two set values.
Syntax Exp1 * Exp2
Types
Exp1 Exp2 Exp1 * Exp2
set[T1] set[T2] rel[T1,T2]
Description Yields a relation resulting from the product of the values of Exp1 and Exp2. It contains a tuple for each combination of values from both arguments.
Examples 
rascal>{1, 2, 3} * {4, 5, 6};
rel[int, int]: {
  <2,4>,
  <3,5>,
  <1,6>,
  <2,5>,
  <3,4>,
  <1,5>,
  <2,6>,
  <1,4>,
  <3,6>
}
Questions
Question 1.
The type of {"Darth Vader", "Forgetful Jones"} * {"Bert", "Darth Vader", "Little Bird", "Lavender"} is

Question 2.
The type of {$2031-10-02, $2044-02-01, $2019-06-02} * {$2020-05-01, $2030-08-01, $2042-10-02, $2010-01-04T14:23:00.484+0100, $2049-08-05T08:25:00.611+0200} is

Question 3. 
{"Isolder", "Hoots The Owl", "Lychee"} * {"Saffron", "E", "Pineapple", "Barkley the Dog", "Coriander"} ==
